zBuUjTaxNR3Au3Tkxap-EQ.text: Hakkasan Mayfair is a very upscale Chinese restaurant that you will not go wrong taking someone out for a special occasion. It's upscale and stylish. The food is on par with the surroundings that you eat in. I only wish that the menu had more variety. I also didn't like the small limited seating but you should definitely check it out if you're in London.

C6oArsPATISBHldoIR4bIQ.text: An absolute must-try! One of the best restaurants in London. Start with the Crispy Duck salad, dim sum, jasmine tea smoked ribs, and more! I literally cannot name a dish I disliked. We usually fill up on the "Small Eats" but if we're going for more we order the Spicy Prawn and Chicken with satay sauce. The service is excellent, in all our visits, we were never disappointed.

ENz7HlE4QbMp_bpHMrM1MA.text: Overall excellent quality food blended with great Cantonese flavours (coming from a Hong Kong Cantonese!). Splendid decor. The dim-sum tasted authentically Chinese, other dishes highly Japanese/Western influenced, finely blended with modern presentation. You will not find the same dishes in a similar top-notch traditional Cantonese restaurant in Hong Kong, e.g. steamed fish, fried tiger prawns, black mushrooms, shark fin soup. Here, you get caviar on peking duck, Wagyu slices, grilled cod fish, and French pastry dessert - all fun and great experience for a Hongkonger. The experience was slightly dampened by the fact that, (1) the Chinese New Year special menu ran out, although we are the first round of customers, on the first CNY day. Most of the other set menus are for 3 people minimum. (2) We were given a time limit for the table, which was not what I expected for a fine dinning experience. I can understand the need of table turnaround and profitability, but given we have spent a good £170 per head, I would think there should be more flexibility.

TF-sEZKKmsgIU0QjkQRRGw.text: Was here on a Saturday night at 11pm... the food was ok.. I wouldn't call it goood, just ok.. the chicken tasted like regular chicken I can get at the store with a Tikka masala taste to it... the shrimp tasted more like Thai than Chinese with a coconut milk taste.. The restaurant was really nice but the music sounded like I was at a nightclub.. me and my friends had a hard time chatting cause the music was so loud...

W287CJPCsFJaoRMCk12bmg.text: Outstanding, one of the best dim sum experiences I've had in London. They do the classics well and there are also interesting experiments, like the duck dumpling with truffle oil. Service is a little slow and it's pretty expensive for what you get, but overall, worth going for when you're looking for a luxury dim sum place.

VGNWf5UGl-23v7VnscZ8rg.text: Hangover cure. Amazing dim sum. Soup dumplings, shrimp and pork, sticky rice and Duke of Wellington pork are winners. For dinner must get the truffle duck.

hxGO89SNSPbrRZ48n30iPw.text: Good high end chinese cuisine.  If you like Tao, you should like the modern and hip decor here.  Through the food is delicious, it's also pretty expensive too.

photos.caption: Photo of Hakkasan Mayfair - London, United Kingdom

J3apKNIIvW-HUIBlx9N6gQ.text: This is a very cool, trendy restaurant. When I visited for the first time, I was a little intimidated by the entrance and the dark, noisy atmosphere. However, the food was excellent and worth every penny just for the experience.

-HizqPmwkZCNE6Pp78XNtQ.text: One of the best pork belly preparations I have ever had! It was fantastic with the citrus from the cumquats. The Wagyu rib-eye was the worst preparation I have had. I love the dish when it is done right but this one was like gnawing on a piece of old rubber boot that had been out in the sun too long and then dipped in soy sauce. Best to avoid it. The design of the restaurant was very nice. All of the staff were fantastic except for our server. His dower personality made us feel very unwelcome and like we were a burden on him. He was abrupt in his responses and overall unhelpful. Like he was just going through the motions to get a paycheck. He turned what would have been an otherwise enjoyable meal into an experience I would have rather avoided. As I said above, all of his colleagues were wonderful and attentive however I will not be returning and would not recommend the restaurant due to the server's treatment of our group. 3 stars not 2 only because of the awesome pork belly!

phcpYtX-inKzHjXEKyr0dA.text: Wonderful!  From start to finish, the entire Hakksan experience was 5-star.  Our server was very friendly and casual, but professional.  The "Black truffle roast duck with tea plant mushroom" may be the best thing I have consumed in years.  It was so good, we ordered a second (and there were only two of us).  We also had the "Pan-fried Wagyu beef in spicy Szechuan sauce" which was very good.  For a starter we tried the "Dim sum platter" and it was exactly perfect for the purpose.  Our wine selection was perfect, thanks to advice from the sommelier.  The manager came by to visit, and was very engaging (more than you would expect).

rRxuXo8ekdzF_MMXRvB8nA.text: Hakkasan London is my absolute favorite place for dinner. Hands down.

Zis-HR28tawcDTbmmS85vg.text: Amazing. One of the best dining experience I've ever had. First off, it is a SCENE. You know, bouncer types with earpieces outside. Inside, lots of pretty people dressed up and eyeing one another while they get f*cked up and eat (or pick at) their overpriced fare. I do enjoy a good scene every now and then, and this one was a hit. The two floors of dark and dimly lit interiors are almost maze-like, but still sexy and inviting. As we waited for our table, our group sipped on Saketinis and another martini with lemongrass. Saketini's were fresh, delicious, not too sweet, and just the right amount of Hendricks. Service was amazing. Food was perfectly timed. Drinks delivered to the right person in the appropriate amount of time. Excellent table maintenance. Whole staff from front desk to management was great. And the food!!! The food was awesome!! It was all a bit small and expensive, but worth it. Along with another person, I was given the privilege of ordering for the table. A sampling of what we got that I would recommend: -Dim Sum platter... about six pieces, three different fillings, all delish. -Soft shell crab... slightly underwhelmed as the one I had at Zuma the previous night was a tad better, but still very good! A bit spicy. -Prawns and foie gras... melts in your mouth! -Roasted Silver Cod... excellent, however the sauce is definitely heavy on the butter and it is quite sweet. Two of us with more delicate stomachs could only have a few bites as it is so rich. -Black truffle duck... Worth moving halfway across the world for. We also had both scallop fried rice and egg fried rice. Scallop was barely noticeable :( so I say stick with egg. We were so stuffed, unfortunately there was no time for dessert. So there you have it. Solid food, served impeccably with a side of scene.

lFWO_x1TU4PHa_y7v0A_ZA.text: The food was top notch, service was ok, and ambiance was great (packed from 11 PM until we left at 1 am).  The DJ was also very good; he spun house music (conversations are possible but not a spot for a quite dinner).  We started with the  shumai and the duck salad (both recommended by the waiter) and both were spectacular.  We had the Peking duck and shrimp and scallop main course and both were very good.  The grilled veggies were ok.  The price was reasonable given the ambiance, location, and quality of food.  The people watching is also great (mostly 20 and 30 something hipsters).

-wB-A0vjY08IS2cz-cmrtA.text: I have reviewed the Fitzrovia Hakkasan location already but I like the Mayfair outfit even more.  I have been there twice now - once in the main dining room downstairs with my family, and more recently in the main floor bar area with my boyfriend.  I'd recommend the downstairs area for a standard 8 or 9pm dinner, but if you want to have a late night meal with a lot of action, try to bar area.  I went there at 11:30pm last Friday and it was a really fun party atmosphere.  Would be a little dark, sexy and loud for a first date maybe, but maybe good for 3rd or 4th date.Went with the duck salad (signature, great dish), dim sum platter, bok choy, a chicken dish and a rice and this was perfect for two substantial meals.

yLq1FlHgjS4IGDFoSVXMGw.text: Good food, however the music was too loud and we had to ask to change the table. Very nice place but a bit crowd.

ggHMb-RFvIQ1m8bUeUXpjw.text: The sea bass and the fillet steak cubes were superb!Also coconut cream and lychee mocktail was very good!

Mou2tkrAW8NkJMD0vc02CA.text: The food here might even be slightly nicer than at the original hakkasan  it was all really really tasty. But then it sort of should be when two of our dishes (wagyu beef and lobster) were £61 each. The service is good, the wine list excellent, and the decor is a similar night club style to the original hakkasan

j4nSwGkpYUl1l9gWz1f22A.text: Ambience was great, food was delicious (crispy duck salad and dumplings to start, followed by the pork belly and chicken claypot), cocktails were creative and well-executed, and the service was impeccable. Loved the hostesses' matching pink dresses. Worth every penny.

BTyc1Rnd9m1nz_u9VA-pmQ.text: As a birthday treat, I was taken here for dinner. On entry, to the left is a bar, where I had a non-alcoholic cocktail called the Kowloon Cooler - absolutely delicious. I liked the service, the bartender was very polite and friendly. Then we went dowstairs to eat, we shared a few dishes, one of which was called stir-fry Welsh black beef (of course being Welsh had to try that one!). The food was very good, waiters were attentive but not annoying. Yes, it was expensive (eventhough I didn't pay), but I enjoyed the food and the service. Dress-wise, everyone looked smart, I just wore a pencil skirt, white blouse and heels. Recommended.

aFQ_i4eoVslTKHhyi9iANQ.text: Traveling and wanted something as authentic as possible to Hong Kong style dim sum.  This is a good place to go.  Pricy, but cool.  A little difficult to find in Soho as it is down an alley.

V29Lt4ml-EE3rrRbwE055Q.text: I went to Hakkasan for lunch with a friend. We ordered a large selection of small dishes (too many, it turned out) and we were very pleased with all of them, some were even amazing. The bill turned out at 80 for two but had we skipped a few dishes and saved us a few calories, we would have gotten away more cheaply. Service wasn't great, the waitress was reasonably friendly but forgot us at times and we had to wait a long time for our food, even though it was past lunch rush hour. The decor is dark and night clubbish and feels dated in my opinion. Despite the negatives, I will probably go back soon as the food is excellent.

OPCdN5OkfXvxooYNY4Kc-w.text: Great food! Great service! Great vibe and funky decor! Great for date night or business dinner.

hKRM-KOaAhtzjmVgA6snrw.text: Totally disgraceful service and behaviour - DO NOT EAT HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO BE TREATED LIKE DIRT. I eat regularly in Mayfair. I took my three colleagues for dinner last night. At the end of a very expensive meal, when we had been at the table for 90 minutes, the waitress said "we'd like to move you to another table in the bar [which was busy and noisy] as people are waiting" - we had not yet even finished our desserts. I explained that we were in the middle of an important discussion (we were) and that 'no, thank you, we don't want to move and please don't ask us again'. The waitress than asked to move us twice more, when eventually we gave up paid and left. We complained as we left to the maitre d'. I have NEVER experienced such rude and unprofessional behaviour in a restaurant that is supposed to be of a good standard. Food was great, as always at Hakkasan, but after that service I will never go back.

79yqbeTXVoDGxsTMM7Y23g.text: Went here on a recent trip to London.  It was excellent!  The atmosphere is very exclusive.  Arrived at 7 pm and had to give our name several times just to get in (do not even bother without a reservation).  Place was empty when we arrived but by 8 pm it was packed.  Fabulous variety of specialty drinks and extensive wine list.  Service was impeccable.  We relied on our server to point us to several interesting dishes after telling her our basic preferences.  The Duck Salad was one of the best dishes I have had anywhere, period.  The warm duck was perfectly cooked, and covered with cool, verily lightly dressed salad.  It was outstanding.  The dim sum platter was 8 pieces (2 of each kind) with shrimp har gu, and several others that were different, interesting and slightly spices.  Chili beef was tender and succulent.  You cannot go wrong here.  This is very high end Asian fusion cuisine, not Chinese American fare. It is not inexpensive, but a very memorable special meal in a delightful atmosphere.  Must try!
